spi.h File Reference

The header file describes the USART SPI mode (for avr) and SPI1 bus (for arm). More...

int HAL_WriteSpi (HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *descriptor, uint8_t *buffer, uint16_t length)
 Writes a length bytes to the SPI.
Callback function will be used to notify about the finishing transmitting. (only for master spi)
int HAL_ReadSpi (HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *descriptor, uint8_t *buffer, uint16_t length)
 For master : writes a number of bytes to the spi.
Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.
The read data is placed to the buffer.
For slave: reads a number of bytes from internal spi buffer and writes them
to application buffer.

Detailed Description

The header file describes the USART SPI mode (for avr) and SPI1 bus (for arm).

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support email: avr@atmel.com

Definition in file spi.h.

Function Documentation

int HAL_OpenSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor)

Open the SPI interface and configure pins.

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to the spi descriptor.
Returns:
-1 - there not are free resources. 0 - SPI channel is ready.
int HAL_CloseSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor)

Close the SPI channel and pins.

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to the spi descriptor.
Returns:
Returns 0 on success or -1 if channel was not opened.
int HAL_WriteSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint16_t  length 
)

Writes a length bytes to the SPI.
Callback function will be used to notify about the finishing transmitting. (only for master spi)

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to spi descriptor
[in]buffer- pointer to application data buffer;
[in]length- number bytes for transfer;
Returns:
-1 - spi module was not opened, there is unsent data, pointer to the data or the length are zero;
0 - on success or a number;
Number of written bytes if the synchronous method is used(callback is NULL),
only for master spi.
int HAL_ReadSpi ( HAL_SpiDescriptor_t *  descriptor,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint16_t  length 
)

For master : writes a number of bytes to the spi.
Callback function will be used to notify when the activity is finished.
The read data is placed to the buffer.
For slave: reads a number of bytes from internal spi buffer and writes them
to application buffer.

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to HAL_SpiDescriptor_t structure
[in]buffer- pointer to the application data buffer
[in]length- number of bytes to transfer
Returns:
-1 - spi module was not opened, or there is unsent data, or the pointer to data or the length are NULL;
0 - success for master;
Number of written bytes if the synchronous method is used(callback is NULL) for master
or number of read bytes from internal buffer to the application buffer for slave.
